verses.kjv: Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;
verses.web: But the Spirit says expressly that in later times some will fall away from the faith, paying attention to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons,
verses.ct: The Holy Spirit says clearly that in the last days, some people will abandon the faith. They'll be drawn in by deceiving spirits and teachings that come from demons,

verses.kjv: Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;
verses.web: through the hypocrisy of men who speak lies, branded in their own conscience as with a hot iron,
verses.ct: spread by hypocritical liars whose consciences have been seared as if branded with a hot iron.

verses.kjv: Forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.
verses.web: forbidding marriage and commanding to abstain from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
verses.ct: These people will forbid marriage and demand that others avoid certain foods — foods that God created to be enjoyed with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.

verses.kjv: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:
verses.web: For every creature of God is good, and nothing is to be rejected, if it is received with thanksgiving.
verses.ct: Everything God created is good, and nothing should be rejected if it's received with thanksgiving,

verses.kjv: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
verses.web: For it is sanctified through the word of God and prayer.
verses.ct: because it is made holy by the word of God and prayer.

verses.kjv: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.
verses.web: If you instruct the brothers of these things, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, nourished in the words of the faith, and of the good doctrine which you have followed.
verses.ct: If you teach these things to the brothers and sisters, you'll be a faithful servant of Christ Jesus, nourished by the truths of the faith and the sound teaching you've been following.

verses.kjv: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.
verses.web: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables. Exercise yourself toward godliness.
verses.ct: Stay away from godless myths and pointless old tales. Instead, train yourself to be godly.

verses.kjv: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.
verses.web: For bodily exercise has some value, but godliness has value in all things, having the promise of the life which is now, and of that which is to come.
verses.ct: Physical training has some value, but godliness is valuable in every way — it holds promise for both this life and the life to come.

verses.kjv: This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.
verses.web: This saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance.
verses.ct: This is a trustworthy saying that deserves to be fully accepted.

verses.kjv: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.
verses.web: For to this end we both labor and suffer reproach, because we have set our trust in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe.
verses.ct: This is exactly why we work so hard and endure criticism — because we've placed our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all people, and especially of those who believe.
Teach and insist on these things.

verses.kjv: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.
verses.web: Let no man despise your youth; but be an example to those who believe, in word, in your way of life, in love, in spirit, in faith, and in purity.
verses.ct: Don't let anyone look down on you because you're young. Instead, set an example for the believers in your speech, your conduct, your love, your spirit, your faith, and your purity.

verses.kjv: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.
verses.web: Until I come, pay attention to reading, to exhortation, and to teaching.
verses.ct: Until I get there, devote yourself to the public reading of Scripture, to encouraging others, and to teaching.

verses.kjv: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.
verses.web: Don’t neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the elders.
verses.ct: Don't neglect the spiritual gift you have, which was given to you through prophecy when the elders laid their hands on you.

verses.kjv: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.
verses.web: Be diligent in these things. Give yourself wholly to them, that your progress may be revealed to all.
verses.ct: Throw yourself into these things completely. Give them your full attention so that everyone can see your growth.

verses.kjv: Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.
verses.web: Pay attention to yourself and to your teaching. Continue in these things, for in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.
verses.ct: Watch your life and your teaching closely. Stay committed to both, because by doing so you will save both yourself and everyone who listens to you.
